English_Sentences: now these are the names of the children of israel which came into egypt every man and his household came with jacob
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaaqoobaara Gibxxe gelida Israaeela attuma naatu sunttai hagaappe kaallidi xaafettiis eti ubbaikka bantta so asaa ekki gelidosona

English_Sentences: reuben simeon levi and judah
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegeetinne Roobeela Simoona Leewa Yihudaa

English_Sentences: issachar zebulun and benjamin
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yisaakoora Zaabiloona Biniyaama

English_Sentences: dan and naphtali gad and asher
Wolaitta_Sentences: Daana Nifttaaleema Gaadanne Aseera

English_Sentences: and all the souls that came out of the loins of jacob were seventy souls for joseph was in egypt already
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaaqooba zerettati muleera laappun tamma Yooseefi kasekka Gibxxe bi uttiis

English_Sentences: and joseph died and all his brethren and all that generation
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yooseefi a ishanttinne he yeleta ubbai haiqqiis

English_Sentences: and the children of israel were fruitful and increased abundantly and multiplied and waxed exceeding mighty and the land was filled with them
Wolaitta_Sentences: shin Israaeela zerettai aifidosonanne keehi daridosona he biittaa kumana gakkanaassi eti keehi corattidosona

English_Sentences: now there arose up a new king over egypt which knew not joseph
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Yooseefa erenna ooratta kawoi Gibxxe biittan denddiis

English_Sentences: and he said unto his people behold the people of the children of israel are more and mightier than we
Wolaitta_Sentences: I ba asaa Beite ha Israaeelati nuuppe keehi corattidosona

English_Sentences: come on let us deal wisely with them lest they multiply and it come to pass that when there falleth out any war they join also unto our enemies and fight against us and so get them up out of the land
Wolaitta_Sentences: Haayite ane nuuni eta hiillan oiqqoos hinna xayikko eti kaseegaappe yaa darana Geelladan oli denddikko eti nu morkketuura gaittidi nuna olananne biittaa yeggidi baana yaagiis

English_Sentences: therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens and they built for pharaoh treasure cities pithom and raamses
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau deexo oosuwan eta tuggayana mala eta bolli meqetti bainna kaabbota sunttidosona Eti kawuwaayyo Piitoomanne Raamisa giyo aibakko minjjiyo katamata keexxidosona

English_Sentences: but the more they afflicted them the more they multiplied and grew and they were grieved because of the children of israel
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Gibxxeti eta unuwaa dariyo wode eti darii yelettidosonanne biittaa gakkidosona Hegaa gishshau Gibxxeti Israaeelatau yayyidosona

English_Sentences: and the egyptians made the children of israel to serve with rigour
Wolaitta_Sentences: yayyidi etau biittaa goggidi ootissidosona

English_Sentences: and they made their lives bitter with hard bondage in morter and in brick and in all manner of service in the field all their service wherein they made them serve was with rigour
Wolaitta_Sentences: Wolqqaama oosuwan siminttuwaaninne xuubiyaa meruwan qassi shooqan oottiyo ubba qommo oosuwan eta deuwaa camettidosona bantta daafurssiya ooso ubbaa qareti bainnan eta ootissidosona

English_Sentences: and the king of egypt spake to the hebrew midwives of which the name of the one was shiphrah and the name of the other puah
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe kawoi Ibraawe maccaasata maaretissiya Xippaaronne Puuho giyo naau maccaasata hagaadan yaagiis

English_Sentences: and he said when ye do the office of a midwife to the hebrew women and see them upon the stools if it be a son then ye shall kill him but if it be a daughter then she shall live
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ibraawe maccaasati yeliyo wode intte maaretissiiddi yelettidabi attuma naa gidikko worite shin macca naa gidikko paxa aggite yaagiis

English_Sentences: but the midwives feared god and did not as the king of egypt commanded them but saved the men children alive
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin maaretissiyaageeti Xoossau yayyidi Gibxxe kawoi eta azazidoogaadan oottibookkona Eti attuma naata paxa ashshidosona

English_Sentences: and the king of egypt called for the midwives and said unto them why have ye done this thing and have saved the men children alive
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Gibxxe kawoi he maaretissiyaageeta xeesidi Intte aissi hagaadan oottidetii Attuma naata aissi paxa aggi bayidetii yaagidi eta oichchiis

English_Sentences: and the midwives said unto pharaoh because the hebrew women are not as the egyptian women for they are lively and are delivered ere the midwives come in unto them
Wolaitta_Sentences: Oichchin maaretissiyaageeti zaaridi Ibraawe maccaasati Gibxxe maccaasatu mala gidokkona eti mino gidiyo gishshau maaretissiyaageeti gakkanaappe kasetidi yeliichchoosona yaagidosona

English_Sentences: therefore god dealt well with the midwives and the people multiplied and waxed very mighty
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Xoossai maaretissiyaageetussi kehiis Asaa qoodaikka gujji gujjidi biidi kaseegaappe yaa corattiis

English_Sentences: and it came to pass because the midwives feared god that he made them houses
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi maaretissiyaageeti Xoossau yayyido gishshau Xoossai etau eta huuphessi so asaa immiis

English_Sentences: and pharaoh charged all his people saying every son that is born ye shall cast into the river and every daughter ye shall save alive
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi ba asaa ubbaa Ibraawetuppe yelettiya attuma naa ubbaa Naile SHaafaa haattan olite shin macca nai yelettikko paxa aggi bayite yaagidi azaziis

English_Sentences: and there went a man of the house of levi and took to wife a daughter of levi
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode issi Leewa qommo gidiya bitanee Leewa maccaasa issinniyo ekkiis

English_Sentences: and the woman conceived and bare a son and when she saw him that he was a goodly child she hid him three months
Wolaitta_Sentences: ekkin a abbe ixettada attuma naaa yelaasu Naai meraa loo naa gidiyoogaa a beada heezzu agina qosaasu

English_Sentences: and when she could not longer hide him she took for him an ark of bulrushes and daubed it with slime and with pitch and put the child therein and she laid it in the flags by the rivers brink
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin a hegaappe daruwaa qosanau danddayennaagaa erada ceeccaappe keeshiyaa ayyo daddaasu daddada renjjiyaaninne shidan meeshada naaa a giddon wottaasu wottada Naile SHaafaa giyo haattaa doonan maqaa giddon wottaasu

English_Sentences: and his sister stood afar off to wit what would be done to him
Wolaitta_Sentences: A michchiyaa i haniyoobaa beanau haahuwan eqqaasu

English_Sentences: and the daughter of pharaoh came down to wash herself at the river and her maidens walked along by the rivers side and when she saw the ark among the flags she sent her maid to fetch it
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe kawuwaa naiyaa bollaa meecettanau Naile SHaafaa giyo shaafaa wodhdhaasu i macca ashkkaratinne haattaa doonan yaa haa hemettoosona a keeshiyaa maqaa giddon beada baada ekkada yaana mala ba ashkkariyo kiittaasu

English_Sentences: and when she had opened it she saw the child and behold the babe wept and she had compassion on him and said this is one of the hebrews children
Wolaitta_Sentences: keeshiyaa pogada he guutta naaa beaasu Beiyo wode i yeekkees yeekkin a ayyo qarettaasu a Hagee Ibraawetu guutta naatuppe issuwaa yaagaasu

English_Sentences: then said his sister to pharaohs daughter shall i go and call to thee a nurse of the hebrew women that she may nurse the child for thee
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode a michchiyaa kawuwaa naiyo Neeyyo ha naaa xanttanau Ibraawe maccaasa issinno ehaanau boo yaagada oichchaasu

English_Sentences: and pharaohs daughter said to her go and the maid went and called the childs mother
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin a Ee ba yaagaasu Yaagin naiyaa baada he naaa aayyiyo ehaasu

English_Sentences: and pharaohs daughter said unto her take this child away and nurse it for me and i will give thee thy wages and the woman took the child and nursed it
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawuwaa naiyaa he maccaasiyo Ha naaa efaada taayyo xanttashsha taani neeyyo damoozaa qanxxana yaagaasu Yaagin maccaasiyaa naaa efaada xanttaasu

English_Sentences: and the child grew and she brought him unto pharaohs daughter and he became her son and she called his name moses and she said because i drew him out of the water
Wolaitta_Sentences: Naai diccin kawuwaa naeekko a ehaasu i iyyo naa gidiis Taani haattaappe a kessaas gaidda a Muusa sunttaasu

English_Sentences: and it came to pass in those days when moses was grown that he went out unto his brethren and looked on their burdens and he spied an egyptian smiting an hebrew one of his brethren
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee diccidi gitaa gididi issi gallassi ba asai deiyoosaa biis biidi eti deexo ooso oottishin eta xeelliis Gibxxe biittaa asa issoi a asatuppe Ibraawetuppe issuwaa wadhdhishin beiis

English_Sentences: and he looked this way and that way and when he saw that there was no man he slew the egyptian and hid him in the sand
Wolaitta_Sentences: I yaa haa xeellin ooninne bainnaagaa beidi he Gibxxe bitaniyaa woriis woridi shaaheeta giddon qottiis

English_Sentences: and when he went out the second day behold two men of the hebrews strove together and he said to him that did the wrong wherefore smitest thou thy fellow
Wolaitta_Sentences: Wonttetta gallassi kiyidi naau Ibraaweti warettiyaageeta beiis Naaqqidaagaa i Neeni ne lagge gidiya Ibraawiyaa aissi dechchai yaagidi oichchiis

English_Sentences: and he said who made thee a prince and a judge over us intendest thou to kill me as thou killedst the egyptian and moses feared and said surely this thing is known
Wolaitta_Sentences: Oichchin he bitanee Nena nu bolli haariyaagaanne daanna ootti sunttidai oonee Neeni he Gibxxe bitaniyaa woridoogaadan tanakka worana qoppaiyye yaagiis Muusee he wode Taani oottidobai erettiichchiis yaagi qoppidi yayyiis

English_Sentences: now when pharaoh heard this thing he sought to slay moses but moses fled from the face of pharaoh and dwelt in the land of midian and he sat down by a well
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi hagaa siyido wode Muusa woranau koyiis shin Muusee kawuwaappe baqatidi Midiyaama biittan deanau biis biidi haatta ollaa doonan uttiis

English_Sentences: now the priest of midian had seven daughters and they came and drew water and filled the troughs to water their fathers flock
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode Midiyaama qeese issuwaayyo laappun macca naati deoosona eti bantta aawaa dorssata haattaa ushshanau wonggiriyan haattaa duuqqi kunttanau yiidosona

English_Sentences: and the shepherds came and drove them away but moses stood up and helped them and watered their flock
Wolaitta_Sentences: Henttanchchati yiidi macca naata yedettidosona shin Muusee denddi eqqidi eta ashshiisinne eta dorssata haattaa ushshiis

English_Sentences: and when they came to reuel their father he said how is it that ye are come so soon to day
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti bantta aawaa Yatirokko yiido wode Hachchi waani eesuwan yiidetii yaagidi oichchiis

English_Sentences: and they said an egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds and also drew water enough for us and watered the flock
Wolaitta_Sentences: Oichchin eti zaaridi Gibxxe biittaa asa issoi nuna henttanchchatuppe ashshiis i nuuyyo haattaakka duuqqidi dorssaa wudiyaa ushshiis yaagidosona

English_Sentences: and he said unto his daughters and where is he why is it that ye have left the man call him that he may eat bread
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin i ba macca naata Yaatin i awan deii Intte he bitaniyaa aissi aggi bayidetii Ane a xeesidi miyoobaa shoobbite yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses was content to dwell with the man and he gave moses zipporah his daughter
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee he bitaniyaara yan deanau maayiis bitaneekka ba naiyo Xippaaro Muuseyyo machcho oottidi immiis

English_Sentences: and she bare him a son and he called his name gershom for he said i have been a stranger in a strange land
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xippaara attuma naaa yelin Muusee a Taani asa biittan bete gidaas yaagiiddi Gershshooma sunttiis

English_Sentences: and it came to pass in process of time that the king of egypt died and the children of israel sighed by reason of the bondage and they cried and their cry came up unto god by reason of the bondage
Wolaitta_Sentences: Daro laittaappe guyyiyan Gibxxe kawoi haiqqiis Israaeelati bantta ailletettaappe oolidosonanne waassidosona bantta ailletettaappe eti waassido waasoi pude Xoossaakko gakkiis

English_Sentences: and god heard their groaning and god remembered his covenant with abraham with isaac and with jacob
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossai eta ooliyaa siyidi i Abrahaamaara Yisaaqaaranne Yaaqoobaara maacetto maachchaa hassayiis

English_Sentences: and god looked upon the children of israel and god had respect unto them
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Xoossai Israaeelata xeellidi etau qoppiis

English_Sentences: now moses kept the flock of jethro his father in law the priest of midian and he led the flock to the backside of the desert and came to the mountain of god even to horeb
Wolaitta_Sentences: Issi wode Muusee Midiyaama biittaa qeesiyaa ba bolluwaa Yatiro dorssata heemmees i he wudiyaa laaggi ekkidi bazzuwau gaxaa gakkanaashin efiis efiidi Xoossaa deriyaa Siinaa Deriyaa gakkiis

English_Sentences: and the angel of the lord appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush and he looked and behold the bush burned with fire and the bush was not consumed
Wolaitta_Sentences: He sohuwan GODAA kiitanchchai buuran eexxiya tama lacuwaa giddon ayyo beettiis buurai taman xuugettikkokka tamai buuraa meennaagaa Muusee beiis

English_Sentences: and moses said i will now turn aside and see this great sight why the bush is not burnt
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Muusee Taani yaa baada buurai aissi taman meetettennaakkonne ha oorattabaa ane beana yaagidi qoppiis

English_Sentences: and when the lord saw that he turned aside to see god called unto him out of the midst of the bush and said moses moses and he said here am i
Wolaitta_Sentences: I beanau yaa biidoogaa GODAI beiis beidi Xoossai buuraa giddoppe a Muusee Muusee yaagidi xeesiis Xeesin Muusee Yee giidi koyiis

English_Sentences: and he said draw not nigh hither put off thy shoes from off thy feet for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground
Wolaitta_Sentences: Koyin Xoossai a Haa shiiqoppa Neeni eqqido biittai geeshsha gidiyo gishshau ne tohuwan deiya caammaa kessa yaagiis

English_Sentences: moreover he said i am the god of thy father the god of abraham the god of isaac and the god of jacob and moses hid his face for he was afraid to look upon god
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassikka GODAI a Taani ne aawaa Xoossaa Abrahaama Xoossaa Yisaaqa Xoossaa Yaaqooba Xoossaa yaagiis Yaagin Muusee Xoossaa xeellanau yayyido gishshau ba somuwaa genttiis

English_Sentences: and the lord said i have surely seen the affliction of my people which are in egypt and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters for i know their sorrows
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI qassikka hagaadan yaagiis Taani Gibxxe biittan ta asai tuggatiyo tuggaa geeshsha beada eti bantta kaabbotuppe waassiyo waasuwaa siyada taani eta waayiyaa qoppaas

English_Sentences: and i am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the egyptians and to bring them up out of that land unto a good land and a large unto a land flowing with milk and honey unto the place of the canaanites and the hittites and the amorites and the perizzites and the hivites and the jebusites
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau taani eta Gibxxe biittaa asatu kushiyaappe ashshanaunne he biittaappe eta kessada aahonne loo biitti ehaanau wodhdhaas He biittai maattainne eessai goggiyo biitta he biittan Kanaaneti Hiiteti Amooreti Parzzeti Hiiwetinne Yaabuusati hai deoosona

English_Sentences: now therefore behold the cry of the children of israel is come unto me and i have also seen the oppression wherewith the egyptians oppress them
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hai Israaeelatu waasoi tana gakkiis Gibxxe biittaa asati eta naaqqiyo naaquwaanne taani beaas

English_Sentences: come now therefore and i will send thee unto pharaoh that thou mayest bring forth my people the children of israel out of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: hegaa gishshau hai ba ta asata Israaeelata Gibxxeppe kessana mala Gibxxe kawuwaakko taani nena kiittais yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses said unto god who am i that i should go unto pharaoh and that i should bring forth the children of israel out of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee Xoossaa Kawuwaakko baanaunne Israaeelata Gibxxeppe kessanau taani oonee yaagiis

English_Sentences: and he said certainly i will be with thee and this shall be a token unto thee that i have sent thee when thou hast brought forth the people out of egypt ye shall serve god upon this mountain
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Xoossai a Taani nenaara gidana qassi taani nena kiittidoogau malaatai hagaa neeni he asaa Gibxxeppe kessido wode ha deriyaa bollan intte Xoossau goinnana yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses said unto god behold when i come unto the children of israel and shall say unto them the god of your fathers hath sent me unto you and they shall say to me what is his name what shall i say unto them
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee Xoossaa Gido shin taani Israaeelatukko baada eta Intte aawatu Xoossai tana inttekko kiittiis yaagin eti tana A sunttai oonee yaagidi oichchikko he wode taani etayyo woiga yootanee yaagiis

English_Sentences: and god said unto moses i am that i am and he said thus shalt thou say unto the children of israel i am hath sent me unto you
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossai Muusa Taani tanattennee neeni Israaeelatuyyo Tanattennee inttekko tana kiittiis yaaga yaagiis

English_Sentences: and god said moreover unto moses thus shalt thou say unto the children of israel the lord god of your fathers the god of abraham the god of isaac and the god of jacob hath sent me unto you this is my name for ever and this is my memorial unto all generations
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossai Muusa qassi Neeni Israaeelata GODAI intte aawatu Xoossai Abrahaama Xoossai Yisaaqa Xoossai Yaaqooba Xoossai i tana inttekko kiittiis yaaga hagee yeletaappe yeletaa gakkanau taani hassayettanau merinau ta suntta

English_Sentences: go and gather the elders of israel together and say unto them the lord god of your fathers the god of abraham of isaac and of jacob appeared unto me saying i have surely visited you and seen that which is done to you in egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ba baada Israaeela cimata shiishshada GODAI intte aawatu Xoossai Abrahaama Yisaaqanne Yaaqooba Xoossai taayyo qoncciis qonccidi tana Taani inttena xomoosaas Gibxxen intte bolli aibi oosettidaakko taani beaas

English_Sentences: and i have said i will bring you up out of the affliction of egypt unto the land of the canaanites and the hittites and the amorites and the perizzites and the hivites and the jebusites unto a land flowing with milk and honey
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani inttena Gibxxe biittaa tuggaappe kessada pude maattainne eessai goggiyo Kanaanetu Hiitetu Amooretu Parzzetu Hiiwetunne Yaabuusatu biitti efaana ga uttaas yaagiis yaaga

English_Sentences: and they shall hearken to thy voice and thou shalt come thou and the elders of israel unto the king of egypt and ye shall say unto him the lord god of the hebrews hath met with us and now let us go we beseech thee three days journey into the wilderness that we may sacrifice to the lord our god
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israaeela cimati ne qaalaa siyana hegaappe guyyiyan neeninne he cimati Gibxxe kawuwaakko biidi a GODAI Ibraawetu Xoossai nunaara gaittiis Hai nuuni heezzu gallassa ogiyaa bazzo hemetti biidi GODAASSI nu Xoossaassi yarshshuwaa yarshshana mala nuna yedda yaagite

English_Sentences: and i am sure that the king of egypt will not let you go no not by a mighty hand
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Wolqqaama kushee a wolqqan yedissana xayikko Gibxxe kawoi inttena yeddennaagaa taani erais

English_Sentences: and i will stretch out my hand and smite egypt with all my wonders which i will do in the midst thereof and after that he will let you go
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau taani ta kushiyaa yeddada eta giddon taani oottiyo ta malaatatu ubban Gibxxeta shocana Hegaappe guyyiyan i inttena yeddana

English_Sentences: and i will give this people favour in the sight of the egyptians and it shall come to pass that when ye go ye shall not go empty
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi taani Gibxxetun ha asaa sabissana yaatobare intte kiyiyo wode kushe mela kiyekketa

English_Sentences: but every woman shall borrow of her neighbour and of her that sojourneth in her house jewels of silver and jewels of gold and raiment and ye shall put them upon your sons and upon your daughters and ye shall spoil the egyptians
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ibraawe maccaasi ubbai ba Gibxxe shooreekkonne ba son deiya Gibxxe maccaasai oona gidinkka ikko biidi bira miishshata worqqa miishshatanne attuma naatinne macca naati maayana maayota Immite giidi oichchana Hegaadan oottidi intte Gibxxetu aquwaa bonqqana yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses answered and said but behold they will not believe me nor hearken unto my voice for they will say the lord hath not appeared unto thee
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee Eti tana ammanennan ixxikko woikko taani odiyoogaa siyennan ixxidi GODAI neeyyo qonccibeenna giikko waanoo yaagidi zaariis

English_Sentences: and the lord said unto him what is that in thine hand and he said a rod
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin GODAI a He ne kushiyan deiyaagee aibee yaagidi oichchiis Oichchin Xamaa yaagiis

English_Sentences: and he said cast it on the ground and he cast it on the ground and it became a serpent and moses fled from before it
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin GODAI a Ane a saan ola yaagiis Yaagin Muusee he gatimaa saan oliis olin shooshsha kiyiis yaatin Muusee appe woxxiis

English_Sentences: and the lord said unto moses put forth thine hand and take it by the tail and he put forth his hand and caught it and it became a rod in his hand
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI a Ne kushiyaa yeddada a goinaa oiqqa yaagiis Muusee yeddidi shooshshaa oiqqin shooshshai a kushiyan simmidi gatimau laamettiis

English_Sentences: that they may believe that the lord god of their fathers the god of abraham the god of isaac and the god of jacob hath appeared unto thee
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Hagee hanidoogee ne aawatu Xoossai Abrahaama Xoossai Yisaaqa Xoossainne Yaaqooba Xoossai neeyyo qonccidoogaa eti ammananaassa yaagiis

English_Sentences: and the lord said furthermore unto him put now thine hand into thy bosom and he put his hand into his bosom and when he took it out behold his hand was leprous as snow
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI a Ne kushiyaa ne shophphan naaqqa yaagin Muusee ba kushiyaa shophphan naaqqiis i kessiyo wode a kushee barottidi shachchaadan booxxiis

English_Sentences: and he said put thine hand into thy bosom again and he put his hand into his bosom again and plucked it out of his bosom and behold it was turned again as his other flesh
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI a Ne kushiyaa ne shophphan zaarada naaqqa yaagiis Yaagin Muusee ba kushiyaa ba shophphau zaari naaqqidi kessiyo wode a kushee simmidi hinkko bollaa mala gidiis

English_Sentences: and it shall come to pass if they will not believe thee neither hearken to the voice of the first sign that they will believe the voice of the latter sign
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassikka GODAI a Eti nena ammanennan ixxikkonne koiro malaataa ammanennan ixxikko naaanttuwaa eti ammanana

English_Sentences: and it shall come to pass if they will not believe also these two signs neither hearken unto thy voice that thou shalt take of the water of the river and pour it upon the dry land and the water which thou takest out of the river shall become blood upon the dry land
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin eti Xoossi oottiyo ha naau malaatata ammanana xayikko woikko neeni odiyoogaa siyennan ixxikko Naile SHaafaappe haattaa ekkada mela biittan gussa neeni shaafaappe ekkido haattai biittan suutta gidana yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses said unto the lord o my lord i am not eloquent neither heretofore nor since thou hast spoken unto thy servant but i am slow of speech and of a slow tongue
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muusee GODAA Abeet Godau taani hagaappe kasekka woikko neeni ne ashkkaraayyo haasayidoosappe simminkka taani biddaa danddayikke taani leddaani haasayais qassi ta inxxarssaikka lufa yaagiis

English_Sentences: and the lord said unto him who hath made mans mouth or who maketh the dumb or deaf or the seeing or the blind have not i the lord
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI a Asaassi doonaa medhdhidaagee oonee A duude woikko tulle oottiyaagee oonee Xeelliyaagaanne qooqe oottiyai oonee Tana GODAA gidikkinaayye

English_Sentences: now therefore go and i will be with thy mouth and teach thee what thou shalt say
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni hai ba taani nena haasayanau maaddana neeni gaanabaanne taani nena tamaarissana yaagiis

English_Sentences: and he said o my lord send i pray thee by the hand of him whom thou wilt send
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee GODAA Godau hayyanaa hagaa oottanau hara asa kiittarkkii yaagiis

English_Sentences: and the anger of the lord was kindled against moses and he said is not aaron the levite thy brother i know that he can speak well and also behold he cometh forth to meet thee and when he seeth thee he will be glad in his heart
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muuseyyo keehi hanqqettidi a Leewa gidiya ne ishaa Aaroonihoo I loo haasayana danddayiyoogaa taani erais hai i nenaara gaittanau yiiddi ogiyaa bollan deees i nena beiyo wode a wozanai ufaittana

English_Sentences: and thou shalt speak unto him and put words in his mouth and i will be with thy mouth and with his mouth and will teach you what ye shall do
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni Yaaga yaaga gaada ayyo odana taani inttena naaaakka haasayanau maaddananne intte oottanabaa tamaarissana

English_Sentences: and he shall be thy spokesman unto the people and he shall be even he shall be to thee instead of a mouth and thou shalt be to him instead of god
Wolaitta_Sentences: I asaayyo ne gishshaa haasayana hegeenne i neeyyo doonaa mala gidin neeni ayyo Xoossa mala gidana giyoogaa

English_Sentences: and thou shalt take this rod in thine hand wherewith thou shalt do signs
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin ooratta malaatata an oottanau neeni ha gatimaa ekkada ba yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses went and returned to jethro his father in law and said unto him let me go i pray thee and return unto my brethren which are in egypt and see whether they be yet alive and jethro said to moses go in peace
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee ba bolluwaa Yatirokko simmi biidi Hanno gakkanaassi paxa deiya asi deikko beanau taani guyye ta asaakko Gibxxe boo yaagiis Yaagin Yatiroi Muusa Ee ba saro gakka yaagiis

English_Sentences: and the lord said unto moses in midian go return into egypt for all the men are dead which sought thy life
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee Midiyaama biittan deishin GODAI a Nena woranau koyida asati ubbai haiqqiichchido gishshau guyye Gibxxe biitti simmada ba yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses took his wife and his sons and set them upon an ass and he returned to the land of egypt and moses took the rod of god in his hand
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muusee ba keettaayyiyoonne ba attuma naata hariyaa togissi ekkidi guyye Gibxxe simettaa doommiis Muusee Xoossaa gatimaa ba kushiyan oiqqidi biis

English_Sentences: and the lord said unto moses when thou goest to return into egypt see that thou do all those wonders before pharaoh which i have put in thine hand but i will harden his heart that he shall not let the people go
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa Neeni Gibxxe simmada biyo wode taani neeyyo immido wolqqan neeni oottana malaatata ubbaa Gibxxe kawuwaa sinttan neeni oottanaagaa baloppa Yaaninkka asaa i yeddenna mala taani a wozanaa dammissana

English_Sentences: and thou shalt say unto pharaoh thus saith the lord israel is my son even my firstborn
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode taani GODAI giyoobaa kawuwaassi hagaadan yaagada oda Israaeeli ta baira naaa

English_Sentences: and i say unto thee let my son go that he may serve me and if thou refuse to let him go behold i will slay thy son even thy firstborn
Wolaitta_Sentences: I taayyo goinnana mala ta naaa neeni yeddana mala taani neeyyo yootaas shin neeni a yeddennan ixxadasa hegaa gishshau taani ne baira attuma naaa worana yaagees yaagada oda yaagiis

English_Sentences: and it came to pass by the way in the inn that the lord met him and sought to kill him
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ogiyan shemppiyoosan GODAI Muuseera gaittiis gaittidi a worana haniis

English_Sentences: then zipporah took a sharp stone and cut off the foreskin of her son and cast it at his feet and said surely a bloody husband art thou to me
Wolaitta_Sentences: A keettaayyiyaa Xippaara saluwaa ekkada ba naaa qaxxaraasu Qaxxarada he shoohuwan Muuse tohuwaa bochchaasu A Muusa Neeni taayyo tumu suutta bullachchaawaa yaagaasu

English_Sentences: so he let him go then she said a bloody husband thou art because of the circumcision
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI hegaa gishshau a worennan aggiis He wode qaxxaraa malaatanau a Neeni taayyo suutta bullachchaawaa yaagaasu

English_Sentences: and the lord said to aaron go into the wilderness to meet moses and he went and met him in the mount of god and kissed him
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Aaroona Neeni Muuseera gaittanau bazzo ba yaagiis Yaagin i biidi Muuseera Xoossaa deriyan gaittidi a yeriis

English_Sentences: and moses told aaron all the words of the lord who had sent him and all the signs which he had commanded him
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee GODAI ba bolli kiittido qaala ubbaanne oottana mala bana azazido ooratta malaatatubaa ubbaa Aaroonayyo yootiis

English_Sentences: and moses and aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of israel
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muuseenne Aarooni biidi Israaeelatu cimata ubbaa shiishshidosona

English_Sentences: and aaron spake all the words which the lord had spoken unto moses and did the signs in the sight of the people
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHiishshin Aarooni GODAI Muuseyyo yootido qaala ubbaa etayyo odiis Qassi Muusee malaatata he asaa sinttan oottiis

English_Sentences: and the people believed and when they heard that the lord had visited the children of israel and that he had looked upon their affliction then they bowed their heads and worshipped
Wolaitta_Sentences: Etikka ammanidosona GODAI etau qoppidoogaanne eta tuggaa beidoogaa siyido wode eti gufannidi goinnidosona

English_Sentences: and afterward moses and aaron went in and told pharaoh thus saith the lord god of israel let my people go that they may hold a feast unto me in the wilderness
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muuseenne Aarooni Gibxxe kawuwaakko yiidi a GODAI Israaeela Xoossai hagaadan yaagees Ta asai taayyo bazzon baalaa bonchchana mala eta yedda yaagees yaagidosona

English_Sentences: and pharaoh said who is the lord that i should obey his voice to let israel go i know not the lord neither will i let israel go
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin kawoi Taani ayyo azazettada Israaeela yeddanau he GODAI oonee Taani GODAA erikke Israaeelakka yeddikke yaagiis

English_Sentences: and they said the god of the hebrews hath met with us let us go we pray thee three days journey into the desert and sacrifice unto the lord our god lest he fall upon us with pestilence or with the sword
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan eti Ibraawetu Xoossai nunaara gaittiis Hai nuuni GODAAYYO nu Xoossaayyo yarshshuwaa yarshshanau heezzu gallassa ogiyaa bazzo giddo baanau nuna yeddarkkii hinna xayikko i nuna boshan woikko olan worana yaagidosona

English_Sentences: and the king of egypt said unto them wherefore do ye moses and aaron let the people from their works get you unto your burdens
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Gibxxe kawoi yaagiis Muusee Aaroonaa Asaa aissi oosuwaa diggeetii Intte oosuwau simmidi biite yaagiis

English_Sentences: and pharaoh said behold the people of the land now are many and ye make them rest from their burdens
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi he wode Beite ha biittan asai corattiis qassi intte eta oosuwaa diggeeta yaagiis

English_Sentences: and pharaoh commanded the same day the taskmasters of the people and their officers saying
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi he gallassi Gibxxetu kaabbotanne Israaeelatu daguwaa sunttata azaziiddi

English_Sentences: ye shall no more give the people straw to make brick as heretofore let them go and gather straw for themselves
Wolaitta_Sentences: Haroodeegaadan xuubiyaa oottiyo utulaa asaayyo ehi immoppite eti utulaa banttau bi biidi shiishshona

English_Sentences: and the tale of the bricks which they did make heretofore ye shall lay upon them ye shall not diminish ought thereof for they be idle therefore they cry saying let us go and sacrifice to our god
Wolaitta_Sentences: shin eti qoodan kaseegaa keena xuubiyaa medhdhidi sheedhdhanaadan azazite he qoodaappe pacissoppite aissi giikko eti azalla eti Nuuni nu Xoossaayyo yarshshuwaa yarshshana mala nuna yedda yaagidi waassiyoogee hegaassa

English_Sentences: let there more work be laid upon the men that they may labour therein and let them not regard vain words
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti oosuwan sheekkana malanne worddo haasayaa siyennan aggana mala etayyo oosuwaa deexettite yaagidi azaziis

English_Sentences: and the taskmasters of the people went out and their officers and they spake to the people saying thus saith pharaoh i will not give you straw
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan he kaabbotinne he sunttati kiyidi asaa Kawoi hagaadan yaagees Simmi taani intteyyo mulekka utulaa immikke

English_Sentences: go ye get you straw where ye can find it yet not ought of your work shall be diminished
Wolaitta_Sentences: intte utulaa demmana danddayiyoosaappe intte huuphen shiishshite shin intte sheedhdhiyo xuubiyaa qoodai mulekka paccenna yaagiis yaagidosona

English_Sentences: so the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of egypt to gather stubble instead of straw
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin asai utulaassi haniyaabaa shiishshanau Gibxxe biitta ubban laalettiis

English_Sentences: and the taskmasters hasted them saying fulfil your works your daily tasks as when there was straw
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxetu kaabboti eta Intteyyo utulaa immiyo wode intte hachchi hachchi oottiyoogaa keenaa oottite yaagidi eta godatidosona

English_Sentences: and the officers of the children of israel which pharaohs taskmasters had set over them were beaten and demanded wherefore have ye not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and to day as heretofore
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxetu kaabboti Israaeelatu daguwaa sunttata wadhdhidi Intte kase oottiyoogaa keena xuubiyaa zino woikko hachchi aissi ootti wurssibeekketii yaagidi oichchidosona

English_Sentences: then the officers of the children of israel came and cried unto pharaoh saying wherefore dealest thou thus with thy servants
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Israaeela sunttati biidi kawuwaayyo magannidosona eti a Neeni ne ashkkarata hagaadan aissi oottai

English_Sentences: there is no straw given unto thy servants and they say to us make brick and behold thy servants are beaten but the fault is in thine own people
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ne ashkkaratuyyo utulaa immokkona shin Xuubiyaa medhdhite yaagoosona yaagidi nuna ne ashkkarata wadhdhoosona shin balai ne asaa bollaana yaagidosona

English_Sentences: but he said ye are idle ye are idle therefore ye say let us go and do sacrifice to the lord
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin kawoi eta Ha azallati Intte azalla Hegaa gishshau intte zaari zaaridi Nuuni GODAAYYO yarshshana baanau nuna yedda yaageeta

English_Sentences: go therefore now and work for there shall no straw be given you yet shall ye deliver the tale of bricks
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hai biite biidi oottite eti intteyyo aiba utulakka immokkona shin intte kaseegaa keena xuubiyaakka medhdheeta yaagiis

English_Sentences: and the officers of the children of israel did see that they were in evil case after it was said ye shall not minish ought from your bricks of your daily task
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israaeelatu sunttati Intte hachchi hachchi medhdhiyo xuubiyaa qoodaa kaseegaappe pacissoppite giido wode eti metuwan gelidoogaa akeekidosona

English_Sentences: and they met moses and aaron who stood in the way as they came forth from pharaoh
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti kawuwaa matappe kiyiiddi Muuseenne Aarooni etaara gaittanau naagiyaageeta demmidosona

English_Sentences: and they said unto them the lord look upon you and judge because ye have made our savour to be abhorred in the eyes of pharaoh and in the eyes of his servants to put a sword in their hand to slay us
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti Inttena GODAI xeello Intte bolli i pirddo Intte nuna kawuwaaninne a oosanchchatun ixissideta qassi eti nuna worana mala bisuwaa eta kushiyan wottideta yaagidosona

English_Sentences: and moses returned unto the lord and said lord wherefore hast thou so evil entreated this people why is it that thou hast sent me
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee GODAAKKO simmidi Godau neeni ha asaa bolli metuwaa aissi ehaadii Neeni tana kiittidoi hagaassee

English_Sentences: for since i came to pharaoh to speak in thy name he hath done evil to this people neither hast thou delivered thy people at all
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani ne sunttan kawuwaayyo haasayanau biido wodeesappe doommin i ha asaa bolli metuwaa ehiis Qassi neenikka ne asaa mule ashshabaakka yaagiis

English_Sentences: then the lord said unto moses now shalt thou see what i will do to pharaoh for with a strong hand shall he let them go and with a strong hand shall he drive them out of his land
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa Taani Gibxxe kawuwaa oottanabaa neeni hai beana ta wolqqaama kushiyaa gaasuwan i eta yeddana ta wolqqaama kushiyaa gaasuwan i eta ba biittaappe laaggidi kessana yaagiis

English_Sentences: and god spake unto moses and said unto him i am the lord
Wolaitta_Sentences: Xoossai qassikka Muusa Taani GODAA

English_Sentences: and i appeared unto abraham unto isaac and unto jacob by the name of god almighty but by my name jehovah was i not known to them
Wolaitta_Sentences: taani Abrahaamayyo Yisaaqayyoonne Yaaqoobayyo Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa gidada qonccaas shin taani GODAA giyo ta sunttan tanatettaa eta erissabeikke

English_Sentences: and i have also established my covenant with them to give them the land of canaan the land of their pilgrimage wherein they were strangers
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi taani etayyo eti bete gididi deido Kanaane biittaa immanau ta maachchaa etaara maacettaas

English_Sentences: and i have also heard the groaning of the children of israel whom the egyptians keep in bondage and i have remembered my covenant
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassikka Gibxxe asati ailleyiyo Israaeelatu ooliyaa taani siyada ta maachchaa hassayaas

English_Sentences: wherefore say unto the children of israel i am the lord and i will bring you out from under the burdens of the egyptians and i will rid you out of their bondage and i will redeem you with a stretched out arm and with great judgments
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau neeni Israaeelata Taani GODAA taani inttena Gibxxetu naaquwaappe kessana taani inttena eta ailletettaappekka goqa kessana qassi taani inttena ta gita wolqqaaninne hanttaara pirddan wozana

English_Sentences: and i will take you to me for a people and i will be to you a god and ye shall know that i am the lord your god which bringeth you out from under the burdens of the egyptians
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani inttena ta huuphe asadan ekkananne taani intte Xoossaa gidana He wode intte taani GODAA intte Xoossaa inttena Gibxxetu ailletettaappe kessidaagaa gidiyoogaa erana

English_Sentences: and i will bring you in unto the land concerning the which i did swear to give it to abraham to isaac and to jacob and i will give it you for an heritage i am the lord
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi taani inttena Abrahaamayyo Yisaaqayyoonne Yaaqoobayyo immanau ta kushiyaa denttada caaqqido biittau ehaana he biittaa taani intteyyo intte gade oottada immana taani GODAA yaaga yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses spake so unto the children of israel but they hearkened not unto moses for anguish of spirit and for cruel bondage
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muusee hagaa Israaeelatuyyo yootiis shin eta heennai meqqido gaasuwaaninne meqetti bainna ailletettaa gaasuwan a qaalaa siyibookkona

English_Sentences: and the lord spake unto moses saying
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa

English_Sentences: go in speak unto pharaoh king of egypt that he let the children of israel go out of his land
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ba baada Gibxxe kawuwaa Israaeelata ne biittaappe kessada yedda yaagada yoota yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses spake before the lord saying behold the children of israel have not hearkened unto me how then shall pharaoh hear me who am of uncircumcised lips
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee GODAA Israaeelati tabaa siyennan ixxaappe attin taani deddotiya inxxarssan haasayiyoogaa kawoi aissi siyii yaagiis

English_Sentences: and the lord spake unto moses and unto aaron and gave them a charge unto the children of israel and unto pharaoh king of egypt to bring the children of israel out of the land of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusanne Aaroona Biite biidi intte Israaeela asaa Gibxxeppe kessana mala taani inttena yeddidoogaa Israaeela asaassinne Gibxxe kawuwaassi yootite yaagidi azaziis

English_Sentences: these be the heads of their fathers houses the sons of reuben the firstborn of israel hanoch and pallu hezron and carmi these be the families of reuben
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eta so asatu halaqati hageeta Israaeelayyo baira naaa Roobeela attuma naati Heenooka Paalu Hexiroonanne Karmma hageeti Roobeela yarata

English_Sentences: and the sons of simeon jemuel and jamin and ohad and jachin and zohar and shaul the son of a canaanitish woman these are the families of simeon
Wolaitta_Sentences: Simoona attuma naati Yimueela Yaamiina Ohaada Yaakiina Xoohaaranne Kanaane biittaa maccaaseeppe yelettida SHaaula hageeti usuppunati Simoona yarata

English_Sentences: and these are the names of the sons of levi according to their generations gershon and kohath and merari and the years of the life of levi were an hundred thirty and seven years
Wolaitta_Sentences: Leewa attuma naati bantta yeletaa maaraadan Gershshoona Qahaatanne Maraara Leewi xeetanne hasttamanne laappun laittaa deiis

English_Sentences: the sons of gershon libni and shimi according to their families
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gershshoona attuma naati bantta yaran yaran Liibinanne SHima geetettoosona

English_Sentences: and the sons of kohath amram and izhar and hebron and uzziel and the years of the life of kohath were an hundred thirty and three years
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qahaata attuma naati Amiraama Yixihaara Kebroonanne Uzzieela Qahaati xeetanne hasttamanne heezzu laitta deiis

English_Sentences: and the sons of merari mahali and mushi these are the families of levi according to their generations
Wolaitta_Sentences: Maraara attuma naati Maahilanne Musha giyoogeeta Bantta Yeletaa maaran Leewa yarati hageeta

English_Sentences: and amram took him jochebed his fathers sister to wife and she bare him aaron and moses and the years of the life of amram were an hundred and thirty and seven years
Wolaitta_Sentences: Amiraami ba aawaa michchiyo Yokebeedo machchiis A Aaroonanne Muusa ayyo yelaasu Amiraami xeetanne hasttamanne laappun laittaa deiis

English_Sentences: and the sons of izhar korah and nepheg and zichri
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yixihaara attuma naati Qoraaha Nefeganne Ziikira

English_Sentences: and the sons of uzziel mishael and elzaphan and zithri
Wolaitta_Sentences: Uzzieela attuma naati Mishaaeela Elxxaafaananne Siitira

English_Sentences: and aaron took him elisheba daughter of amminadab sister of naashon to wife and she bare him nadab and abihu eleazar and ithamar
Wolaitta_Sentences: Aarooni Aminadaaba naiyo Naasoona michchiyo Elisheebo machchiis Yaatin a ayyo Nadaaba Abiiha Elaazaranne Itaamaara yelaasu

English_Sentences: and the sons of korah assir and elkanah and abiasaph these are the families of the korhites
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qore attuma naati Asiira Elqqaananne Abiyaasaafa hageeti Qore yaratu maizza aawata

English_Sentences: and eleazar aarons son took him one of the daughters of putiel to wife and she bare him phinehas these are the heads of the fathers of the levites according to their families
Wolaitta_Sentences: Aaroona naai Elaazari Putieela naatuppe issinno machchiis a ayyo Piinihaasa yelaasu Hageeti bantta yaran yaran Leewatu keettaa asaa halaqata

English_Sentences: these are that aaron and moses to whom the lord said bring out the children of israel from the land of egypt according to their armies
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Gibxxe biittaappe Israaeelata eta citan citan kessite yaagidoi ha Muusanne ha Aaroona

English_Sentences: these are they which spake to pharaoh king of egypt to bring out the children of israel from egypt these are that moses and aaron
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israaeelata Gibxxe biittaappe kessiyoogaa Gibxxe kawuwaassi haasayidaageeti eta Hageeti he Muusanne he Aaroona

English_Sentences: and it came to pass on the day when the lord spake unto moses in the land of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Gibxxen Muuseyyo haasayido wode a

English_Sentences: that the lord spake unto moses saying i am the lord speak thou unto pharaoh king of egypt all that i say unto thee
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani GODAA taani neeyyo yootiyoobaa ubbaa neeni Gibxxe kawuwaayyo yoota yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses said before the lord behold i am of uncircumcised lips and how shall pharaoh hearken unto me
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee GODAA Taani deddotiya inxxarssan haasayiyaagaa gidishin kawoi taani yootiyoobaa waati siyanee yaagiis

English_Sentences: and the lord said unto moses see i have made thee a god to pharaoh and aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan GODAI Muusa Bea taani nena Gibxxe kawuwaayyo Xoossa mala oottaas ne ishai Aarooni ne hananabaa yootiyaagaa gidana

English_Sentences: thou shalt speak all that i command thee and aaron thy brother shall speak unto pharaoh that he send the children of israel out of his land
Wolaitta_Sentences: taani nena azazido ubbaa neeni ayyo yootaasa ne ishaa Aarooni Israaeelata ba biittaappe kessi yeddana mala kawuwaayyo yootees

English_Sentences: and i will harden pharaohs heart and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin taani kawuwaa wozanaa dammissana taani Gibxxe biittan ta ooratta malaataanne maalaalissiyaabaa darissada oottikkokka

English_Sentences: but pharaoh shall not hearken unto you that i may lay my hand upon egypt and bring forth mine armies and my people the children of israel out of the land of egypt by great judgments
Wolaitta_Sentences: i intte yootiyoobaa siyenna He wode taani ta kushiyaa Gibxxetu bolli denttana taani ta citaa ta asaa Israaeela wolqqaama pirddan Gibxxeppe kessana

English_Sentences: and the egyptians shall know that i am the lord when i stretch forth mine hand upon egypt and bring out the children of israel from among them
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi Gibxxeti taani ta kushiyaa Gibxxe bolli denttada Israaeelata eta giddoppe kessido wode taani GODAA gidiyoogaa eti erana yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses and aaron did as the lord commanded them so did they
Wolaitta_Sentences: Muuseenne Aarooni likke GODAI eta azazidoogaadan oottidosona

English_Sentences: and moses was fourscore years old and aaron fourscore and three years old when they spake unto pharaoh
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti kawuwaayyo yootiyo wode Muusee hosppun tammu laitta asa Aarooni qassi hosppun tammanne heezzu laitta asa

English_Sentences: and the lord spake unto moses and unto aaron saying
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusanne Aaroona hagaadan yaagiis

English_Sentences: when pharaoh shall speak unto you saying shew a miracle for you then thou shalt say unto aaron take thy rod and cast it before pharaoh and it shall become a serpent
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi inttena Xoossai oottiyo malaataa tana bessite giyo wode neeni Aaroona Ne gatimaa ekkada kawuwaa sinttan ola yaaga yaatobare i shooshsha kiyana yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses and aaron went in unto pharaoh and they did so as the lord had commanded and aaron cast down his rod before pharaoh and before his servants and it became a serpent
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muuseenne Aarooni kawuwaakko gelidosona gelidi likke GODAI eta azazidoogaadan oottidosona Aarooni ba gatimaa kawuwaa sinttaaninne a oosanchchatu sinttan oliis olin shooshsha kiyiis

English_Sentences: then pharaoh also called the wise men and the sorcerers now the magicians of egypt they also did in like manner with their enchantments
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoi aadhdhida eranchchatanne bitanchchata xeesissiis xeesissin etikka ha Gibxxetu shareechchoti bantta eeqan hegaadan oottidosona

English_Sentences: for they cast down every man his rod and they became serpents but aarons rod swallowed up their rods

Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe asai Israaeelati biittaappe eesuwan kiyana mala dirbbissidosona Aissi giikko eti Hinna xayikko nuuni ubbaikka wuroos yaagidosona

English_Sentences: and the people took their dough before it was leavened their kneadingtroughs being bound up in their clothes upon their shoulders
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Israaeela asati bantta irshshoi gelibeenna munaqaa munaqa keriyan kunttidi bantta maayuwan xaaxidi bantta hashiyan tookkidosona

English_Sentences: and the children of israel did according to the word of moses and they borrowed of the egyptians jewels of silver and jewels of gold and raiment
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israaeelati Muusee eta azazidoogaadan Gibxxeta bira miishshata worqqa miishshatanne maayuwaa Immite giidi oichchidosona

English_Sentences: and the lord gave the people favour in the sight of the egyptians so that they lent unto them such things as they required and they spoiled the egyptians
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Gibxxetu sinttan he asai sabettanaadan oottin Gibxxeti eti oichchidobaa immidosona Hegaadan yaatidi eti Gibxxe asatu aquwaa bonqqi ekkidi biidosona

English_Sentences: and the children of israel journeyed from rameses to succoth about six hundred thousand on foot that were men beside children
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israaeelati Raamisa giyo katamaappe denddidi Sukkota giyo sohuwaa tohuwan hemettidi biidosona Asai naatanne maccaasaa gujjennan qoodin usuppun xeetu shaa

English_Sentences: and a mixed multitude went up also with them and flocks and herds even very much cattle
Wolaitta_Sentences: Qassi etaara hara daro asai daro meheenne dorssaa deeshshaa wudee laagettidi biis

English_Sentences: and they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought forth out of egypt for it was not leavened because they were thrust out of egypt and could not tarry neither had they prepared for themselves any victual
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxeppe eti ekkidi kiyido munaqaa irshshoi gelibeennaagaa oittaa uukkidosona aissi giikko eti Gibxxeppe dirbban kiyidosona banttau shinqqe kattanaukka munaqi denddin uukkanaukka eta gattibeenna

English_Sentences: now the sojourning of the children of israel who dwelt in egypt was four hundred and thirty years
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israaeelati Gibxxe biittan deido laittai oiddu xeetanne hasttama

English_Sentences: and it came to pass at the end of the four hundred and thirty years even the selfsame day it came to pass that all the hosts of the lord went out from the land of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: He oiddu xeetanne hasttamu laittai wuriyo he wurssetta gallassan GODAA asai ubbai Gibxxe biittaappe kiyiis

English_Sentences: it is a night to be much observed unto the lord for bringing them out from the land of egypt this is that night of the lord to be observed of all the children of israel in their generations
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI ba asaa naagidi Gibxxe biittaappe kessiyo wode saai qamma he qammai yeletaappe yeletaa gakkanaassi Israaeela asai beegottidi naagiiddi aqiyo GODAAYYO dummatida qamma

English_Sentences: and the lord said unto moses and aaron this is the ordinance of the passover there shall no stranger eat thereof
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusanne Aaroona Paasikaa gallassaa bonchchiyo wogai hageeho bete asi appe mulekka mooppo

English_Sentences: but every mans servant that is bought for money when thou hast circumcised him then shall he eat thereof
Wolaitta_Sentences: Intte miishshan shammido aillee intte a qaxxaridoogaappe guyyiyan appe mo

English_Sentences: a foreigner and an hired servant shall not eat thereof
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin haissau inttenaara takkiya imattinne kera oottiya imatti appe mooppo

English_Sentences: in one house shall it be eaten thou shalt not carry forth ought of the flesh abroad out of the house neither shall ye break a bone thereof
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ha Paasikaa intte issi keettan miite intte he ashuwaappe aibanne kare kessoppite Meqettatuppe issuwaanne menttoppite

English_Sentences: all the congregation of israel shall keep it
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israaeela maabarai ubbai Paasikaa bonchchanau koshshees

English_Sentences: and when a stranger shall sojourn with thee and will keep the passover to the lord let all his males be circumcised and then let him come near and keep it and he shall be as one that is born in the land for no uncircumcised person shall eat thereof
Wolaitta_Sentences: Beti yiidi intte giddon deiya asi GODAA Paasikaa bonchchanau koyikko ba so attuma asa ubbaa qaxxaretto Hegaappe guyyiyan i he biittan yelettida asadan shiiqidi Paasikaa bonchchanau danddayees SHin qaxxarettibeenna asi mulekka appe mooppo

English_Sentences: one law shall be to him that is homeborn and unto the stranger that sojourneth among you
Wolaitta_Sentences: Intte biittan yelettidaagaukka intte giddon bete gididi deiyaagaukka he wogai issuwaa yaagiis

English_Sentences: thus did all the children of israel as the lord commanded moses and aaron so did they
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Israaeelati ubbai GODAI Muusanne Aaroona azazidoogaadankka oottidosona

English_Sentences: and it came to pass the selfsame day that the lord did bring the children of israel out of the land of egypt by their armies
Wolaitta_Sentences: He gallassikka GODAI Israaeelata eta citan citan Gibxxe biittaappe kessiis

English_Sentences: and the lord spake unto moses saying
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa hagaadan yaagiis

English_Sentences: sanctify unto me all the firstborn whatsoever openeth the womb among the children of israel both of man and of beast it is mine
Wolaitta_Sentences: Baira yelettida attuma ubbaa taayyo dummaya Israaeela asaa giddon uloppe yelettida bairi ubbi mehiyaa gidin asaa gidin ubbaikka tabaa yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses said unto the people remember this day in which ye came out from egypt out of the house of bondage for by strength of hand the lord brought you out from this place there shall no leavened bread be eaten
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee asaa Gibxxeppe ailletettaa biittaappe intte kiyido gallassaa ha gallassaa hassayite aissi giikko GODAI ba wolqqaama kushiyan inttena kessiis hegaa gishshau irshshoi gelidobaa aibanne mooppite

English_Sentences: this day came ye out in the month abib
Wolaitta_Sentences: Intte hachchi Abiiba aginan kiyeeta

English_Sentences: and it shall be when the lord shall bring thee into the land of the canaanites and the hittites and the amorites and the hivites and the jebusites which he sware unto thy fathers to give thee a land flowing with milk and honey that thou shalt keep this service in this month
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Kanaanetu Hiitetu Amooretu Hiiwetunne Yaabuusatu biittaa inttena gattiyo wode intte ha bonchcho gallassaa ha aginaa bonchcheeta He biittai GODAI inttessi immana mala kase intte aawatussi caaqqi wottido biittaa He biittai maattainne eessai goggiyo biittaa

English_Sentences: seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread and in the seventh day shall be a feast to the lord
Wolaitta_Sentences: Intte laappun gallassi irshshoi yegettibeenna oittaa maana laappuntta gallassai GODAA baalaa gidana

English_Sentences: unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days and there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee neither shall there be leaven seen with thee in all thy quarters
Wolaitta_Sentences: He laappun gallassatun irshshoi yegettibeenna oittaa intte maana intte giddon irshshoora deiyaabi aibinne beettoppo ne biittaa zawan awaaninne irshshoi beettoppo

English_Sentences: and thou shalt shew thy son in that day saying this is done because of that which the lord did unto me when i came forth out of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: He gallassi neeni ne naaayyo Taani hagaa oottiyoogee taani Gibxxeppe kiyiyo wode GODAI taayyo oottidoogaa hassayanaassa yaagada yoota

English_Sentences: and it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thine hand and for a memorial between thine eyes that the lords law may be in thy mouth for with a strong hand hath the lord brought thee out of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI inttena ba wolqqaama kushiyan Gibxxeppe kessido gishshau GODAA higgee intte doonaappe wodhdhennaadan ha bonchchettiya ayyaana gallassai ne kushiyan qachchidonne ne merchchiyan wottido hassayissiyaabaa mala gidana

English_Sentences: thou shalt therefore keep this ordinance in his season from year to year
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau intte ha wogaa laittan laittan keerido wodiyan bonchchite

English_Sentences: and it shall be when the lord shall bring thee into the land of the canaanites as he sware unto thee and to thy fathers and shall give it thee
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI intteyyoonne intte maizza aawatuyyo immanau caaqqidoogaadan i inttena Kanaanetu biittaa gelissidi he biittaa intteyyo immiyo wode

English_Sentences: that thou shalt set apart unto the lord all that openeth the matrix and every firstling that cometh of a beast which thou hast the males shall be the lords
Wolaitta_Sentences: uloppe baira yelettida ubbaa GODAAYYO dummaya ne mehiyan baira yelettiya attuma ubbai GODAASSA

English_Sentences: and every firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb and if thou wilt not redeem it then thou shalt break his neck and all the firstborn of man among thy children shalt thou redeem
Wolaitta_Sentences: Baira yelettiya hare ubbaa dorssa maran woza ekka wozennabaa gidikko a morggiyaa mentta ne attuma naatu giddon baira yelettidaageeta ubbaa woza

English_Sentences: and it shall be when thy son asketh thee in time to come saying what is this that thou shalt say unto him by strength of hand the lord brought us out from egypt from the house of bondage
Wolaitta_Sentences: Sinttaara yaana wodiyan ne naai nena Hagee aibee yaagidi oichchikko neeni a GODAI nuna wolqqaama kushiyan Gibxxeppe ailletettaa biittaappe kessiis

English_Sentences: and it came to pass when pharaoh would hardly let us go that the lord slew all the firstborn in the land of egypt both the firstborn of man and the firstborn of beast therefore i sacrifice to the lord all that openeth the matrix being males but all the firstborn of my children i redeem
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe kawoi dammidi nuna yeddennan ixxin GODAI Gibxxe biittan deiya baira ubbaa asaappe doommidi mehiyaa bairaa gakkanaassi woriis Taani aayi uloppe koiro yelettida attumaa ubbaa GODAASSI yarshshiyoogeenne ta baira attuma naata taani woziyoogee hegaassa yaaga

English_Sentences: and it shall be for a token upon thine hand and for frontlets between thine eyes for by strength of hand the lord brought us forth out of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI nuna ba wolqqaama kushiyan Gibxxeppe kessidoogau hagee intteyyo kushen qachchidonne merchchen wottido malaata mala gidana yaagiis

English_Sentences: and it came to pass when pharaoh had let the people go that god led them not through the way of the land of the philistines although that was near for god said lest peradventure the people repent when they see war and they return to egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi asaa yeddido wode Xoossai eta Pilisxxeema biittaara kanttissiya ogee mata gidikkonne he ogiyaara kaalettibeenna aissi giikko Xoossai Asai olaa beikko ba qofaa laammidi guyye Gibxxe simmanaakkonne yaagidi qoppiis

English_Sentences: but god led the people about through the way of the wilderness of the red sea and the children of israel went up harnessed out of the land of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau Xoossai asaa bazzo ogiyaara yuushshidi Zoo Abbaakko kaalettiis Israaeelati Gibxxe biittaappe olau giigidi pude kiyidosona

English_Sentences: and moses took the bones of joseph with him for he had straitly sworn the children of israel saying god will surely visit you and ye shall carry up my bones away hence with you
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yooseefi Israaeela asaa caaqetti wottido gishshau Muusee a meqettaa banaara ekkidi biis Yooseefi eta Xoossai tumuppe inttena maaddanau yaana he wode intte ta meqettaa ha sohuwaappe pude inttenaara ekkidi biite yaagidi odi wottiis

English_Sentences: and they took their journey from succoth and encamped in etham in the edge of the wilderness
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti Sukkotappe denddidi bazzuwaa doonan deiya Etaaman uttidosona

English_Sentences: and the lord went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud to lead them the way and by night in a pillar of fire to give them light to go by day and night
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI eti gallassikka qammikka hemettana mala gallassan eta ogiyaa bessanau shaaraa tuussan qammi etau pooissanau tamaa tuussan eta kaalettiis

English_Sentences: he took not away the pillar of the cloud by day nor the pillar of fire by night from before the people
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gallassi shaaraa tuussai woikko qammi tamaa tuussai asaa sinttappe kichchibeenna

English_Sentences: and the lord spake unto moses saying
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusa GODAI hagaadan yaagiis

English_Sentences: speak unto the children of israel that they turn and encamp before pihahiroth between migdol and the sea over against baalzephon before it shall ye encamp by the sea
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti guyye simmidi Migidoolappenne abbaappe gidduwan Pihaahiroota matan uttanaadan oda eti abbaa lanqqen BaaaliXafoonau sintta baazzan uttona

English_Sentences: for pharaoh will say of the children of israel they are entangled in the land the wilderness hath shut them in
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi Israaeelati bazzoi gorddin haniyoobaa xayidi biittan coo toilattoosona yaagidi qoppana

English_Sentences: and i will harden pharaohs heart that he shall follow after them and i will be honoured upon pharaoh and upon all his host that the egyptians may know that i am the lord and they did so
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani kawuwaa wozanaa dammissana i eta yedettana taani kawuwaa baggaaranne a olanchchatu ubbaa baggaara taani bonchchettana Gibxxetinne taani GODAA gidiyoogaa erana yaagiis Yaagin Israaeelati i yootidoogaadan oottidosona

English_Sentences: and it was told the king of egypt that the people fled and the heart of pharaoh and of his servants was turned against the people and they said why have we done this that we have let israel go from serving us
Wolaitta_Sentences: Asai baqatiichchidoogaa Gibxxe kawuwaayyo yootin inne a sunttati Israaeelatuyyo qoppido bantta qofaa laammidi Nuuni hagaa waatiyoonii Nuuni Israaeelata yeddidi eti nuuyyo oottiyo wolqqaappe mela attida yaagidosona

English_Sentences: and he made ready his chariot and took his people with him
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau i ba para gaariyaa kooridi ba olanchchata banaara ekkidi denddiis

English_Sentences: and he took six hundred chosen chariots and all the chariots of egypt and captains over every one of them
Wolaitta_Sentences: I usuppun xeetu ubbaappe aadhdhiya para gaareta Gibxxe biittan deiya hara gaaretu ubbaara eta ubbau halaqaa halaqaa sunttidi ekkidi biis

English_Sentences: and the lord hardened the heart of pharaoh king of egypt and he pursued after the children of israel and the children of israel went out with an high hand
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Gibxxe biittaa kawuwaa kawuwaa wozanaa dammissin kessaa bolli deiya Israaeela asaa yedettiis

English_Sentences: but the egyptians pursued after them all the horses and chariots of pharaoh and his horsemen and his army and overtook them encamping by the sea beside pihahiroth before baalzephon
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Gibxxe asati kawuwaa parati ubbainne paraa gaareti paraasatinne olanchchati Israaeelata kaallidi yedettidosona Abbaa doonan BaaaliXafoona sintta baazzan deiya Pihaahiroota matan eti uttidaashin demmidosona

English_Sentences: and when pharaoh drew nigh the children of israel lifted up their eyes and behold the egyptians marched after them and they were sore afraid and the children of israel cried out unto the lord
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawoi matiichchin Israaeelati xoqqu gi xeelliyo wode Gibxxeti eta geeduwaa kaallidi yiidoogaa beidosona beidi daroppe yayyidi GODAAYYO waassidosona

English_Sentences: and they said unto moses because there were no graves in egypt hast thou taken us away to die in the wilderness wherefore hast thou dealt thus with us to carry us forth out of egypt
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti Muusa Neeni nuna Gibxxen duufoi xayin bazzon haiqqanaadan kessadiiyye Nuna Gibxxeppe aibau ehaadii

English_Sentences: is not this the word that we did tell thee in egypt saying let us alone that we may serve the egyptians for it had been better for us to serve the egyptians than that we should die in the wilderness
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxen deiiddi nuuni Nuna aggaaga nuuni Gibxxetuyyo haarettana yaagidi neeyyo odibookkonii Bazzon haiqqanaappe etayyo haarettiyoogee nuuyyo loo shin yaagidosona

English_Sentences: and moses said unto the people fear ye not stand still and see the salvation of the lord which he will shew to you to day for the egyptians whom ye have seen to day ye shall see them again no more for ever
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Muusee asaa Yayyoppite minni eqqite GODAI hachchi inttena ashshiyo ashettaa intte beana Hachchi intte beiyo Gibxxeta naaantto mulekka beekketa

English_Sentences: the lord shall fight for you and ye shall hold your peace
Wolaitta_Sentences: Intte gishshaa GODAI olettana intteppe koyettiyai cou geetta xalaala yaagiis

English_Sentences: and the lord said unto moses wherefore criest thou unto me speak unto the children of israel that they go forward
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa Neeni taakko aissi waassai Israaeelati sinttau hemettana mala yoota

English_Sentences: but lift thou up thy rod and stretch out thine hand over the sea and divide it and the children of israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ne gatimaa dentta denttada abbaa bolli micca haattai naau kiyidi shaahettana Israaeelatikka mela biittaara abbaa pinnidi baana

English_Sentences: and i behold i will harden the hearts of the egyptians and they shall follow them and i will get me honour upon pharaoh and upon all his host upon his chariots and upon his horsemen
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani Gibxxetu wozanaa dammissin eti intte geeduwaa kaallidi abban gelana Taani kawuwaanne a olanchchatu ubbaa baggaara a para gaaretunne a paraasatu baggaara bonchchuwaa taayyo demmana

English_Sentences: and the egyptians shall know that i am the lord when i have gotten me honour upon pharaoh upon his chariots and upon his horsemen
Wolaitta_Sentences: Taani kawuwaa baggaara a para gaaretu baggaaranne a paraasatu baggaara taayyo bonchchuwaa demmido wode taani GODAA gidiyoogaa Gibxxeti erana yaagiis

English_Sentences: and the angel of god which went before the camp of israel removed and went behind them and the pillar of the cloud went from before their face and stood behind them
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Xoossaa kiitanchchai Israaeela olanchchatuppe sinttaara hemettiyaagee guyye aadhdhidi etappe guyyeera hemettiis SHaaraa tuussaikka eta sinttan deiyoosaappe guyye baggi yuuyidi

English_Sentences: and it came between the camp of the egyptians and the camp of israel and it was a cloud and darkness to them but it gave light by night to these so that the one came not near the other all the night
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxetu olanchchatuppenne Israaeelatu olanchchatuppe gidduwan eqqiis He shaarai qamma ubban issi baggaara xumissidi hinkko baggaara pooissiis yaatin qamma ubbaa issoi issuwaakko shiiqibookkona

English_Sentences: and moses stretched out his hand over the sea and the lord caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night and made the sea dry land and the waters were divided
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee abbaa bollan ba kushiyaa micciis GODAI he gallassi qamma ubban arshsho wolqqaama carkkuwaa yeddidi abbaa guyye zaariis zaaridi mela biitta kessiis Haattai shaahettiis

English_Sentences: and the children of israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand and on their left
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israaeelati abbaa gidduwan mela biittaara hemettidi haattai etayyo ushachchaaranne haddirssaara godadan eqqidaashin biidosona

English_Sentences: and the egyptians pursued and went in after them to the midst of the sea even all pharaohs horses his chariots and his horsemen
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxeti eta yedettidosona kawuwaa para ubbati a para gaaretinne a paraasati eta kaallidi abbaa giddo gelidosona

English_Sentences: and it came to pass that in the morning watch the lord looked unto the host of the egyptians through the pillar of fire and of the cloud and troubled the host of the egyptians
Wolaitta_Sentences: Biron bakkaalee dolanaappe kasetidi GODAI tamaanne shaaraa tuussaappe duge zaaridi Gibxxetu olanchchata xeelliis xeellidi eta wozanaa bashshiis

English_Sentences: and took off their chariot wheels that they drave them heavily so that the egyptians said let us flee from the face of israel for the lord fighteth for them against the egyptians
Wolaitta_Sentences: Laagoi eta waissana mala GODAI eta para gaaretu irzzuwaa binqqirssaa diggiis diggin Gibxxeti GODAI eta maaddidi Gibxxe oliyo gishshau ane nuuni Israaeela asaappe baqatoos yaagidosona

English_Sentences: and the lord said unto moses stretch out thine hand over the sea that the waters may come again upon the egyptians upon their chariots and upon their horsemen
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI Muusa Haattai Gibxxetu bolli eta para gaaretu bollinne eta paraasatu bolli guyye goggana mala ne kushiyaa abbaa bollan micca yaagiis

English_Sentences: and moses stretched forth his hand over the sea and the sea returned to his strength when the morning appeared and the egyptians fled against it and the lord overthrew the egyptians in the midst of the sea
Wolaitta_Sentences: Yaagin Muusee ba kushiyaa abbaa bollan micciis saai wonttishin abbai ba kase sohuwaa guyye simmiis Gibxxeti yaa a giddo baqatishin GODAI Gibxxeta abbaa gidduwan aatti yeggiis

English_Sentences: and the waters returned and covered the chariots and the horsemen and all the host of pharaoh that came into the sea after them there remained not so much as one of them
Wolaitta_Sentences: Haattai guyye simmidi para gaareta paraasatanne Israaeelata kaallidi abbaa gelida kawuwaa olanchchata muliyaa mitti bayiis etappe issoinne attibeenna

English_Sentences: but the children of israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand and on their left
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin Israaeelati abbaa gidduwaara mela biittan hemettidi haattai etau ushachchaaranne haddirssaara godadan eqqidaashin biidosona

English_Sentences: thus the lord saved israel that day out of the hand of the egyptians and israel saw the egyptians dead upon the sea shore
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI he gallassi Israaeela asaa Gibxxetu kushiyaappe hagaadan ashshiis Qassi Israaeelati Gibxxeti haiqqidi zinidaageeta abbaa doonan beidosona

English_Sentences: and israel saw that great work which the lord did upon the egyptians and the people feared the lord and believed the lord and his servant moses
Wolaitta_Sentences: Israaeelatikka GODAI Gibxxetu bolli bessido gita wolqqaa beido wode asai GODAAYYO yayyiis yayyidi akka a ashkkaraa Muusakka ammaniis

English_Sentences: then sang moses and the children of israel this song unto the lord and spake saying i will sing unto the lord for he hath triumphed gloriously the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode Muuseenne Israaeela asai ha mazamuriyaa GODAAYYO yexxidosona Bonchchuwan i keehi xoqqu xoqqu giido gishshau taani GODAAYYO mazamuriyaa yexxana Paraanne paraa toggidaagaa abban oliis

English_Sentences: the lord is my strength and song and he is become my salvation he is my god and i will prepare him an habitation my fathers god and i will exalt him
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI ta wolqqaanne ta mazamuriyaa i tana ashshiyaagaa gidiis I ta Xoossaa taani a sabbana I ta aawaa Xoossaa taani a xoqqu xoqqu oottana

English_Sentences: the lord is a man of war the lord is his name
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI olanchcha a sunttaikka GODAA

English_Sentences: pharaohs chariots and his host hath he cast into the sea his chosen captains also are drowned in the red sea
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe kawuwaa para gaaretanne a olanchchata abban oliis Gibxxe kawuwaa halaqati ubbaappe aadhdhi loiyaageeti Zoo Abban muukettidosona

English_Sentences: the depths have covered them they sank into the bottom as a stone
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ciimma haattai eta kammiis eti shuchchadan ciimman mitettidosona

English_Sentences: thy right hand o lord is become glorious in power thy right hand o lord hath dashed in pieces the enemy
Wolaitta_Sentences: Abeet GODAU ne ushachcha kushee wolqqan goobidaagaa GODAU ne ushachcha kushee morkkiyaa mentterettiis

English_Sentences: and in the greatness of thine excellency thou hast overthrown them that rose up against thee thou sentest forth thy wrath which consumed them as stubble
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ne bonchchuwaa gitatettan nenaara gaaddetidaageeta oladasa Ne eexxiya hanqquwaa neeni yeddin i eta daladan miis

English_Sentences: and with the blast of thy nostrils the waters were gathered together the floods stood upright as an heap and the depths were congealed in the heart of the sea
Wolaitta_Sentences: Ne siiriyaara kiyiya shemppuwan haattai doorettiis Goggiya haattainne godadan minni eqqiis ciimma haattati abbaa gomppan irkkidi minnidosona

English_Sentences: the enemy said i will pursue i will overtake i will divide the spoil my lust shall be satisfied upon them i will draw my sword my hand shall destroy them
Wolaitta_Sentences: Morkkee ceeqettiiddi Taani eta yedettada oiqqana Taani eta aquwaa shaakkada ta koyidobaa ubbaa ekkana Taani ta bisuwaa shoddada eta xaissana yaagidi ceeqettiis

English_Sentences: thou didst blow with thy wind the sea covered them they sank as lead in the mighty waters
Wolaitta_Sentences: SHin neeni eta ne shemppuwan punnin abbai eta kammiis Eti wolqqaama haattan irssaasiyaa giyo biratai mitettiyoogaadan mitettidosona

English_Sentences: who is like unto thee o lord among the gods who is like thee glorious in holiness fearful in praises doing wonders
Wolaitta_Sentences: Abeet GODAU Xoossatu giddon ne malai oonee Geeshshatettan bonchchettiyaabi bonchchuwan yayettiyaabi garamiyaabaa oottiyaabi ne malai oonee

English_Sentences: thou stretchedst out thy right hand the earth swallowed them
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni ne ushachcha kushiyaa miccin biittai eta mittiis

English_Sentences: thou in thy mercy hast led forth the people which thou hast redeemed thou hast guided them in thy strength unto thy holy habitation
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni wozido asaa aggenna ne siiquwan kaalettana Neeni ne wolqqan eta neeni deiyo geeshsha sohuwaa gelissadasa

English_Sentences: the people shall hear and be afraid sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of palestina
Wolaitta_Sentences: Kawotettati hegaa siyidi kokkoridosona Pilisxxeema biittaa asatikka maareti oiqqidobaadan unettidosona

English_Sentences: then the dukes of edom shall be amazed the mighty men of moab trembling shall take hold upon them all the inhabitants of canaan shall melt away
Wolaitta_Sentences: He wode Eedooma biittaa halaqati dagammidosona Mooaaba biittaa haariyaageeta yashshai kokkorssiis Kanaane asati maashidosona

English_Sentences: fear and dread shall fall upon them by the greatness of thine arm they shall be as still as a stone till thy people pass over o lord till the people pass over which thou hast purchased
Wolaitta_Sentences: Dagamainne yashshai eta oiqqiis Abeet GODAU eti ne wolqqaa gitatettaa beidi ne asai aadhdhana gakkanaassi neeni wozido asai aadhdhana gakkanaassi shuchchadan tolettidi eqqidosona

English_Sentences: thou shalt bring them in and plant them in the mountain of thine inheritance in the place o lord which thou hast made for thee to dwell in in the sanctuary o lord which thy hands have established
Wolaitta_Sentences: Neeni eta ehaada ne buzo gaden deiya deriyaa huuphiyan tokkana Abeet Godau he sohoi neeni neeyyo deanau oottido soho Abeet Godau he geeshsha sohoi neeni ne kushiyan minttada essido soho

English_Sentences: the lord shall reign for ever and ever
Wolaitta_Sentences: GODAI merinaappe merinau kawotana yaagidi yexxidosona

English_Sentences: for the horse of pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea and the lord brought again the waters of the sea upon them but the children of israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea
Wolaitta_Sentences: Gibxxe kawuwaa parati a para gaaretinne a paraasati abban gelido wode GODAI eta bolli abbaa haattaa guyye zaaridi eta bolli ehiis shin Israaeelati abbaa gidduwaara mela biittaara hemettidi biidosona

English_Sentences: and miriam the prophetess the sister of aaron took a timbrel in her hand and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances
Wolaitta_Sentences: Aaroona michchiyaa hananabaa yootiya Miiriyaama karaabiyaa ekkaasu maccaasai ubbai karaabiyaa baqqiiddinne yexxiiddi o kaallidosona

English_Sentences: and miriam answered them sing ye to the lord for he hath triumphed gloriously the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea
Wolaitta_Sentences: Miiriyaama etayyo mazamuriyaa yexxaidda GODAI keehi xoqqu xoqqu giido gishshau ayyo yexxite Paraanne paraa toggidaagaa i abban oliis yaagada yexxaasu

English_Sentences: so moses brought israel from the red sea and they went out into the wilderness of shur and they went three days in the wilderness and found no water
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan Muusee Israaeela Zoo Abbaappe kaalettin eti Suura giyo bazzuwaa biidosona He bazzuwan eti haatta demmennan heezzu gallassaa hemettidosona

English_Sentences: and when they came to marah they could not drink of the waters of marah for they were bitter therefore the name of it was called marah
Wolaitta_Sentences: Eti Maara giyoosaa gakkido wode Maara haattai camo gidido gishshau uyana danddayibookkona hegaa gishshau he sohoi Maara geetettiis

English_Sentences: and the people murmured against moses saying what shall we drink
Wolaitta_Sentences: Hegaa gishshau asai Nuuni ai uyanee yaagidi Muuse bolli zuuzummiis

English_Sentences: and he cried unto the lord and the lord shewed him a tree which when he had cast into the waters the waters were made sweet there he made for them a statute and an ordinance and there he proved them
